title: Ticket #2509: condor_q -better crashes the negotiator for the first job
description:
Remove accountant log, then restart condor. Submit a job whose requirements are false, then run

condor_q -better <job_id>

The negotiator aborts with: 

09/28/11 17:07:00 Getting state information from the accountant
09/28/11 17:07:00 ERROR "Expected AcctLog entry "Customer.<none>" to exist" at line 1153 in file /scratch/gthain/CONDOR_SRC/src/condor_negotiator.V6/Accountant.cpp
remarks:
2011-Sep-28 18:24:38 by eje:
Happens only when GROUP_NAMES is undefined. The (re)init logic needs some tweaking for the "no groups" code path to make sure "<none>" is properly handled, since it always exists.

2011-Sep-29 12:12:28 by eje:
This is a bug introduced by hierarchical group quotas, but was brought into sharp relief by #1926, which caused an exception when it didn't find an entry for group it was expecting to find.

2011-Sep-29 12:16:09 by eje:
REPRO/TEST:

Configure a condor pool with no accounting groups.

Then, invoke condor_userprio while job que is still empty. It will fail (and also cause the negotiator to throw an exception) 

$ condor_userprio -all -allusers
failed to get classad from negotiator

after bug fix, condor_userprio will work correctly on startup with an empty queue: 

$ condor_userprio -all -allusers
Last Priority Update:  9/29 09:59
                                    Effective   Real     Priority   Res   Total Usage       Usage            Last
User Name                           Priority  Priority    Factor    Used (wghted-hrs)    Start Time       Usage Time
------------------------------      --------- -------- ------------ ----  ----------- ---------------- ----------------
<none>                                   0.50     0.50         1.00    0         0.00 12/31/1969 17:00        ???
------------------------------      --------- -------- ------------ ----  ----------- ---------------- ----------------
Number of users: 0                                                     0         0.00 12/31/1969 17:00        ???
check_ins:
2011-Oct-31 12:07   Check-in [28058]: We're not using "the Accountant" in our descriptions. See #2522 for that policydecision. It is also accepted practice to put the cause of the bug in the version history item. Both of these problems corrected with a rewrite. ===GT=== #2509 (By Karen Miller )
2011-Sep-29 12:09   Check-in [27466]: ===VersionHistory:Completed=== ===GT=== #2509 (By Erik Erlandson )
2011-Sep-29 12:05   Check-in [27465]: Fixed bug in Accountant init where table entries for accounting groups were not created on init/reconfig ===GT:Fixed=== #2509 (By Erik Erlandson )
creator: gthain
